fields.summary: indexing on additional webserver?

fields.description:
When you uninstall plugin, red box appears saying "Please select Plugin"
However, the selected plugin was silently removed in the background already without appropriate notification being displayed.

Please modify the message, it is missleading and an user may wonders what to do next? What plugin to select, I just unistalled it?
fields.summary: After un-installing plugin notification is incorrect

fields.description:
In Administration -> Cache Statistics

The "Flush All" link results in Page not found, and the caches are not cleared.
fields.summary: Flush All Caches link broken

fields.description:
Two things that would make complete confluence as a corporate intranet/knowledgebase/collaboration tool

* An Address book per (global AND per space)

* A Calendar (global, per person and per space) to organize events, appointments, meetings etc
fields.summary: Address Book and Group Calendar Support

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7003].
  {panel}

We are soon migrating all of our documentation to a Confluence site, and the strategy we had planned for new page creation by users was to have them prepare drafts in their own personal space, and then move the final page to the appropriate global space, according to a pre-defined structure.  Such a strategy prevents us against having DRAFT pages in our production spaces.  In order to enforce the strategy, we need to be able to track MOVES, so that we check if users put their pages at the right location.

In their present state, the Watch and Daily Summary e-mails are not helping us much for that purpose.  When a page has been created and modified in the last 24 hours, it appears as CREATED in the Daily Summary e-mail, which is great!  However, if a page was created yesterday, and then completed and moved today in the proper global space, it will only appear as LAST EDITED... in the Daily Summary or in the Watch e-mail subject.

We DON'T want to monitor every EDITED page, only when they're MOVED.  Is there any way to realize this with the present Confluence versions?  If not, it would be of great help if we could watch MOVED pages in any way (Watch, Daily Summary, RSS Feed or whatever else).

Thanks for letting me know if it can be realized now, or else what could be the timeframe within which we could expect this improvement to be done.
fields.summary: Monitoring MOVED pages with Watch, Daily Summary or other
Rebuild index for one space or page-tree

fields.description: Several people in the office are reporting that they are not receiving the Daily Updates email even though they have checked the box.  They still continue to receive the individual emails whenever changes occur.
fields.summary: CLONE -Subscription to Daily Updates not working

fields.description: When searching for 'Customers by Country' it does not find the following page (which includes the term 'Customers by Country' in a table column header): http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/SALES/Atlassian+Global+Sales+versus+IT+Markets
fields.summary: Search not finding specific page

fields.description:
When searching 'All Spaces' (Location = 'All Spaces) the text indicating how many matches there are in other spaces is being displayed with a value > 0. 

This seems illogical given the search scope has already been set to 'All Spaces'. 

When searching 'customer' on EAC we received the following related matches message: "There are 2 matches in other spaces. Include these matches."

I think this might be a bug.
fields.summary: Related matches in other spaces displaying illogical count
Importing data - in progress estimates need improvement
escaped characters consistent'y unescape themselves when entering rich text editor

fields.description: When you insert an image the conversion from HTML to markup produces the markup foo!bar.jpg!, which doesnt parse as an inserted image
fields.summary: Rich text editor inserts images with no space between text and '!'

fields.description:
After creating a POP mail account under Browse Space -> Mail Accounts and editing it, the protocol choices are limited to POP or POPS. Options for IMAP and IMAPS should be available when changing the protocol for an existing account, not just when creating a new one.

Workaround is to create a new IMAP account and delete the POP account instead of editing.
fields.summary: Editing an existing POP mail account does not allow the protocol to be changed to IMAP or IMAPS

fields.summary: Error while generating PDF on Extranet
Markup umbrella issue - errors switching between modes or rendering escaped content

fields.description:
I've tried adding an image, which is on another page, to a comment:

!An Innovative Approach^cloud2.jpg!

In the comment preview, the image appears. However, when the comment is saved, the image is broken and I get this:

com.atlassian.confluence.pages.Comment

I'm guessing that the comment renerer doesn't have access to the required helper or something?
fields.summary: Can't link to image attachments stored on other pages from within comments (but it works in preview of the comment)

fields.description:
Arbitrary Javascript placed on a wiki page is executed if it is in the "blurb" included in the {index} macro.

Example:
page 1 contents:
{index}

page 2 (within same space as page 1) contents:
<script>
alert("We have a problem...");
</script>

Go to page 1.  The index, including a brief summary of page 2, should appear.  An alert window will pop up.  In fact, any HTML will be rendered, so this may lead to additional problems I have not investigated
fields.summary: Javascript in wiki page executed by {index}

fields.description: The userlister macro doesn't seem to function properly with confluence authenticating against AD.  We are able to authenticate with AD groups, and in the administration function I can browse the group in question and see all members, but putting a macro of {userlister:groups=AD.Group} returns nothing at all.  There are no errors generated that I can see, just no userlist expansion.
fields.summary: userlister macro does not seem to function with Active Directory groups

fields.description:
Attempting to view the source of an old version of a page (info tab > click on the old version -> info tab -> view source) takes you to the source for the latest version of the page, not the source of the version of the page you're viewing. It looks like the ID in the link is the latest version, rather than the one you're browsing.

I've reproduced this on my local 2.2 instance and on CAC running 2.2.9.
fields.summary: "View Source" on old versions of pages links to the source of the latest version

fields.description:
Since CONF-6817, internationalisation works in the WYSIWYG editor.  However, multiple en.js files need to be translated in order to localise it.  Furthermore, any missing translations result in the key being displayed, rather than the english or nothing.  

If we don't somehow source the strings from ConfluenceActionSupport.properties, then we need to at least update:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DISC/Language+Pack+Translations
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Language+Pack+Plugins
fields.summary: Simplify Rich Text Editor localisation

fields.description: Since CONF-6817 it is now possible to add internationalisation of theme names and descriptions.  Only Left Navigation Theme has actually been done.  The others all still need doing.
fields.summary: Most Plugin Themes require name and description i18n

fields.description:
We have recently observed that the confluence is not automatically updating its 'Recently Updated' Section on Dashboard.
We have being doing  'Content indexing' every hour to update the section.

Also sometime Indexing get stop at 99% completion, and we see error like

'Error rendering macro: com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneException: java.io.FileNotFoundException: /home/indus/portal/tomcat8209/confluenceHome/index/_1c5l.fnm (No such file or directory)' in 'Recently Updated' Section

In that case we need to restart the confluence and do the reindexing which then works !!.

I m not getting hint of what is happening. Please do let me know in case of you having any idea about it and also if any other information is required.

Thanks & Regards,
Girish Tyagi
fields.summary: 'Recently Updated' section not  getting updated.

fields.description: wwwww
fields.summary: wwwwww

fields.description:
2006-09-13 11:37:40,692 ERROR [confluence.extra.globalstats.GlobalStatisticsManager] doSqlCountQuery Unable to perform query [select count(c.*) from CONTENT as c where c.SPACEID = 15 and c.PREVVER is null and c.CONTENTTYPE = 'BLOGPOST']: java.sql.SQLException: Line 1: Incorrect syntax near '*'.
java.sql.SQLException: Line 1: Incorrect syntax near '*'.


Some databases do not recognise the 'AS' keyword in that statement, hence returning 0 in the column when statistics ran . Needs to be fixed to '...from CONTENT c where...'
fields.summary: Global Statistics Plugin - incorrect SQL statement

fields.description:
We've just been dealing with a support request for a client and unearthed this little gem...

[APIM20:1.0 General^1.1.1 Policy and Instruction Manual.pdf]

That link does not work (checked that the space key, page title and filename were all correctly specified).

So we tried uploading a file with a simpler name:

[APIM20:1.0 General^test.pdf]

And that worked!

Seems that the link renderer is getting confused by the numbers or spaces or .'s in the filename or something?
fields.summary: Links to attachments (where the filename starts with numbers) on other pages don't work.

fields.description:
When adding an image to a column in a multi-column layout, if the ALIGN attribute is used to align the image to the left, the text of the column overflows the column boundary on the right and is rendered behind the adjacent column, potentially making it invisible/unreadable. 

If the image is aligned to the right, this doesn't happen, but certain elements (like tables) will overflow the image itself, depending on the height of the image. 

See screenshots for more details.
fields.summary: Image with ALIGN attribute overflows columns

fields.description:
Currently, if you change a page name or move it to a new space, any refernences such as [page] or [space:page] or even [alias|page] are renamed, and I haven't tested it deeply, but I think {include:page} are also renamed.

However, my own {edit-include:page} is not renamed, so links are often broken. Also, the {metadata-from:page|key} macros and many many others are not renamed. 

Referncing a page is a common activity.  I would like a 'weakly-typed' (or even strongly-typed if you want) page refernece parameter for *all* user macros, which supports page renaming.

Any named user macro parameter that is 'page' or 'pages' or 'target' or 'targets' or 'root' (and perhaps a few other common words) almost exclusively refer to a page (or perhaps a comma or semicolon delimited list of pages.)  Therefor this sort of change would be almost certainly backwards compatible in most cases, and would also enforce people using these parameter names carefully in the future macros.

I propose if there is a named parameter of one of the above, the content of the parameter is treated as though it is a page reference, and it is updated when the page name changes. Also, if there is a unamed parameter which corresponds to the name of an existing page, it should also be treated as a page reference.

These references are also not counted in the 'incoming-links', and in most cases it would also be good to have the association between two pages that is made by a macro indexed in the incoming links table.

Thanks,
fields.summary: Automatically rename page references by edit-include and metadata plugin on page name change
Index macro display with long URLs on pages reduces usability
Accesskey to go to parent of current page

fields.description: Right now it takes a confluence-administrator to manage memberships to groups. It would be very useful to have the ability to delegate the responsibility for managing individual groups to "ordinary" confluence-users.
fields.summary: Enable members of conflunece-user to Manage Groups

fields.description:
I am posting this as a bug here, but have also posted it on the forums: http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=13074

Basically, we need to give everyone in the company access to certain spaces within Confluence.  But no group explicitly lists all employees.  We do however have parent groups, which list children groups, which in turn list users.  However, Confluence does not support nested groups, so even if we give access to the parent groups, access does not get granted to the users of the children groups.

This is really proving to be a show stopper for us right now.

Sincerely,

Einar Mykletun
fields.summary: Lack of LDAP Nested-Group Support

fields.description:
Compare this diff 

http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/diffpages.action?pageId=173353&originalId=188947#change8

with the original text

http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=173353

The diff reads 

'attach.desc=Es können keine erstellt deren Name ''+'' oder ''&'' ' 

but it should really read

'attach.desc=Es können keine Dateianhänge erstellt werden, deren Name ''+'' oder ''&'' enthält.'
fields.summary: Text missing from article diff

fields.description:
The tab is visible, but when clicked it just redirects to the "not permitted" page again (there is no security issue here)

Note: if you have Space Admin permissions, you can still edit the page. This is by design.

The tab should be removed.
fields.summary: Users who can not view a page due to page level permissions can still see the edit tab

fields.description:
For some reason thumbnails are broken on the first time they are viewed through the browser. Hitting the browser refresh button enables the image to appear.
(Note: this is happening on head)
fields.summary: Thumbnail does not get downloaded on the first time it is viewed

fields.description:
Replication path:

From the dashboard, click on the link for "Displaying pages recently added to _your favourites list_"

The URL path will read something like: http://YOURDOMAIN/label/my:favourite

If you have over 10 favorites listed, thus causing paging to occur, if you click on the Next link or one of the numbered page links, you get an error. (See screenshot). 

The only known workaround is to click the "Favouriote
fields.summary: Favorites listing on Personal Labels page -- paging broken

fields.description:
Personal spaces do not show up on the dashboard. That is good for the "All" tab view to reduce cluttering.

OTOH, it _would_ be nice to see, who has a personal space.

Please add a "Personal" (or similar) tab to the space section of the dashboard.  Upon selecting that tab, a list of personal spaces (only) should be shown.

Thanks for a great product!
fields.summary: Add tab for personal spaces to dashboard

fields.description:
After clearing an obsolete group of its members and removing the group itself, I was no longer able to access any of the spaces to which the group was permissioned (before being removed), except as an admin user. Attempting such access was giving an immediate system error (complaining about getActiveGroups() not being able to find a SpacePermission object with a particular ID - presumably that of the removed group).

After getting that error, and going past the initial shock and horror (at the downtime this would have caused to a lot of people the next Monday morning at work), I looked around the spacepermissions table, finding that there was indeed no record with such an ID in the table. This made suspect a problem with caching not being invalidated. I then went into the administration console and flushed all caches. Thankfully that immediately fixed the problem and I was able to access all those spaces again as a non-admin user.

Anyway,  looks like your group removal code is not invalidating the caches it should...

Close call, and it also made me realize that backups hadn't been happening recently due to backup volume permissioning problems ironically: so maybe this was a blessing in disguise!
fields.summary: Removing a group which permissions to certain spaces prevents access to those spaces (workaround: flush all caches)

fields.description:
We use Confluence for creating a standard 'web site' that consumers browse to, at least for some of our spaces. And, we link between the confluence portion of our site and the non-confluence portion of the site. However, because the links are 'external', Confluence includes the little external link icon next to these links. This is confusing to our users.

We suggest that you add the ability to disable and/or customize this icon (and potentially others). 

Our current workaround is the change the confluence installation, and change the external link icon to an empty gif. Unfortunately, we can't do this by space.
fields.summary: Add ability to disable/customize external link icon.

fields.description:
The xmlrpc storePage() allows the user to provide a page title that contains trailing spaces. EG "This is a test page " But when {children} is placed in the parent page of such a created page. The children macro links to "This is a test page" removing the trailing space, this linking to a nonexistent page that it wants created.

This isn't a huge problem at all. It's just unexpected behaviour. I've changed my code to remove trailing whitespaces from titles.
fields.summary: Creating a page via xmlrpc allows for whitespace at end of title, but macros like {children} do not support this.

fields.description: There seems to be a problem with our instructions on USER-105 for enabling the AtlassianUser dynamic group support.
fields.summary: Cannot start Confluence after configuring LDAPDynamicGroupAdaptor

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6960].
  {panel}

Confluence needs to create an audit trail for administrative changes, similar to JRA-3157.  In particular, it is important to create an audit trail for all changes to users and groups. 

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of Tue 9 February 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Thank you for your votes and comments on this issue, along with your ongoing patience.

I am pleased to announce that this feature has now been released, including including logging of:
* Space management (e.g. create, delete, export)
* User & Group Management
* Global Permissions
* General Admin (e.g. Mail server)
* Plugin management
* Applinks (create/delete)

Regards,
Adam
Confluence Product Management
abarnes at atlassian dot com
{panel}
fields.summary: Administration audit trail
XML-RPC updateIssue() works with other properties, but not with 'status' parameter
Macro to list recent comments ordered by creation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6957].
  {panel}

Feedback from one of our customer:

>  * Bulk Page import was missing some very basic functionality.  I
>   think at a minimum it should have a browse button for the
>   directory and the "select parent page" link that is provided on
>   the page editor.  All the pages that I uploaded went directory to
>   the space home which makes it impossible to use the hierarchy. 
>   Another helpful feature here would be a pre/post template box
>   where you could add custom tags that would wrap the file being
>   imported (e.g. {code}).
fields.summary: Import Pages from Disk improvements

fields.description:
Create a Seraph Authenticator which can add a user to confluence-users (or some other nominated local group) when they log in.

This will allow LDAP users to use Confluence without being explicitly made members of a group.
fields.summary: Automatic group membership on authentication

fields.description:
Basically, just check the status of the favourite items and then update the message 'Add/Remove this page from your favourite list' to a message describing the available action on that item. i.e if the item list is in the favourite item list, the only available action should be to remove it. And vice versa.
Fix this also for the 'Spaces' part of Dasboard.
fields.summary: Modify favourite tooltips on dashboard to indicate Add or Remove
Add events for space and global permission changes

fields.description:
Apparently there are some serious problems with the RSS produced by Confluence, as reported by Guy Fraser below.

Perhaps we should investigate updating Rome (the library used for generating RSS and Atom), or replacing it with a Velocity solution which we can control.

Guy Fraser writes:

"I've also been having terrible problems with Confluence RSS feeds - it seems that very few pieces of software can actually read them (even when anonymous access is allowed to both the site and all the spaces). Unlike all other popular blog sites and wikis, the Confluence RSS feeds seem to be working to a different standard that isn't widely supported, or there is some problem with their content type or something?

"The content type is definitely set wrong (most browsers and other readers offer to save the file to disk) and the fact that there is no .rss extension to the action also causes some problems in badly written RSS readers (where they expect a .rss extension on the URL - sloppy, I know, but there are lots of them out there).

"It might be worth taking the format of RSS feeds from a popular blogging site, etc., and using the same format XML as they do as well as the same sort of content type.

"It should be noted that the problems seem to apply to the Feed Builder (which is pretty much useless as nothing can read the feeds, regardless of what version of RSS or Atom I choose) and also the elusive RSS feeds that are available in the "Advanced" tab (and, from memory, the {globalreports} macro or something like that)."
fields.summary: RSS parsing and content-type problems

fields.description:
Attempting to use LDAP integration with the LDAPDynamicGroupAdaptor produces the errors in the attached errors.txt file during Weblogic startup.
The paddle tool lists our users and groups but does not see group membership (log enclosed).
Removing the <classes> and <groupAdaptor> elements from atlassian-user.xml (enclosed) prevents thes errors and does expose LDAP groups and users to Confluence, but group membership is not carried over.

Thanks for your attention.
fields.summary: LDAP Dynamic Group Adaptor
Second access to same attachment stored in database is not found

fields.description:
When exporting pages to a PDF that contain a template such as {info:icon=false} the PDF does not export properly.  All the text in the info box is placed onto individual lines for each word, which obviously makes the PDF file incredibly long and preety much useless.

Changing the template to include the icon resolves the issue.
fields.summary: Export to PDF using icon=false in templates results in PDF with each word on it's own line

fields.description:
I see two may be equal entries in my favorites list. If I want to delete the entry with the yellow star a very ugly big window appears (see part of this as screentot attached, I couldn't  cut&paste text from it)).

I am not able to delete my favourites.

Regards, Ingo

fields.description: occasionally we have the need to place a link in a wiki document which should open the link in a new window rather than in the current window.
fields.summary: open link in an external window

fields.description:
somewhat frequently we have a need to place a URL on a wiki page but do not wish the URL to act as a link; confluence always assumes that a URL should be a link. it would be nice to have the ability to tell confluence when we want it to treat text as text regardless of what the text is.

e.g. confluence considers the text "http://abc.def" to be a link to the same URL, perhaps confluence could recognize that "[!http://abc.def]" is to be treated as text rather than as a URL.
fields.summary: non-URL text

When exporting a space to HTML with pages containing double quotes in the title, I get the error below.  Replacing the double quotes with single quotes works around the problem.

Apparently the same issue occured in the past with PDF space export, and was solved (see CONF-1719).



Cause:
com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\Apps\_CONFDATA_\temp\export_09062006_163603\name\Example "Edit lithology".html (The filename, directory name, or volume label syntax is incorrect) at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.HtmlExporter.doExportEntity(HtmlExporter.java:184)	
caused by: java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\Apps\_CONFDATA_\temp\export_09062006_163603\name\Example "Edit lithology".html (The filename, directory name, or volume label syntax is incorrect) at java.io.FileOutputStream.open(Native Method)

fields.description:
At the moment we are using Confluence with MySQL but are planning to migrate the system to our Oracle database. For testing I have exported the production system running with MySQL and tried to import the XML content to our test environment which is connected to our Oracle database. During the import the process stopped with the message:
Import failed. :(HibernateTemplate): data integrity violated by SQL ''; nested exception is java.sql.BatchUpdateException: ORA-00001: unique constraint (CONFLUENCE.SYS_C009145) violated
I disabled this constraint but got errors from other constraints (SYS_C009570, SYS_C009689, SYS_C009808, etc.)
fields.summary: Unique constraint violated when importing Confluence export into Oracle database
Add a setting to disable referrer collection entirely
Add option to use fdp to graphviz plugin

fields.description: The char is only visible in the rich text editor and only if i create a link, save the page, edit the page again in rich text editor. The char is not really there. If i look in the text representation of the page, all is fine.
fields.summary: A quadratic char is visible after links in Internet Explorer in Rich Text Editor.

fields.description:
After uploading an attachment with spaces, the file is downloaded with plus symbols instead in both IE and Firefox despite the MIME type being specified correctly. For example, 'New Text Document.txt' is downloaded as 'New+Text+Document.txt'. Confirmed with doc and txt file types.

http://localhost:8080/download/attachments/255/New+Text+Document.txt?version=1 downloads displays inline as New+Text+Document.txt and downloads with that filename, but this also occurs on other filetypes which don't display inline.

Response Headers - http://localhost:8080/download/attachments/255/New+Text+Document.txt?version=1
Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1
Last-Modified: Tue, 05 Sep 2006 07:35:19 GMT
Etag: "1157441719000"
content-disposition: inline; filename="New Text Document.txt"
Content-Type: text/plain;charset=UTF-8
Content-Length: 4
Date: Tue, 05 Sep 2006 07:41:36 GMT
200 OK
fields.summary: Spaces in attachment filenames are converted to plus symbols when downloaded

fields.description:
Presently, the Attachment Settings under the General Configuration affects the loading of space logo file size. This seems to be OK as far as the max attachment size is consistently verified by ConfluenceWebWorkConfiguration.

Two problems:
1. When I set the attachment size and try to load the logo file larger then the predefined file size I should get an error different to the one below.

The following error(s) occurred:

    * Could not locate uploaded logo in request. Double check the file you are sending through.
ConfigureSpaceLogoAction

The error should be more descriptive to clearly state that the file attempted to upload is larger then allowed. Not that it is not found.

2. Also, ones you load the logo, the only way of removing it is to set the Logo back to default. This mean, when you want to revert the process, you need to upload the logo again. Kind of user-unfriendly :-) There should be an option to remove the logo. Or when using the default logo, one should be able to use already uploaded logo. Can we store it somewhere and be able to retrieve it when needed? Or is this "unwanted" behaviour?

Ib
fields.summary: ConfigureSpaceLogoAction affected by attachment size

fields.description:
According to our documentation, the getPermissions() and getPermissionsForUser() methods can return up to four values:

- view
- modify
- comment
- admin

Internally, the "modify" value is returned if the user has EDIT permission on the space, which is only true if the user is a space admin. What we should check is whether the user has CREATEEDIT_PAGE_PERMISSION on the space, which will be a much more sensible "modify" permission.
fields.summary: Remote API method getPermissions() only returns "modify" for space admins

fields.description: Related to this parent task, there is still a minor bug where the matched term is not highlighted in the search results for Japanese text search. Please see screenshots attached comparing an English text search to a Japanese text search. The search logic itself runs fine with CJK content indexing selected. Could you please ensure that the matched text highlighting is fixed in future release?
fields.summary: Highlighting of matched terms in search results does not work in Japanese

fields.description:
On a re-index of Confluence, while reading .doc and .xls documents, error messages are output by the POI library. These warnings are unactionable and can be safely suppressed. For example:

[WARNING] Unknown Ptg 3d (61)
[WARNING] Unknown Ptg 2a (42) at cell (24,0)
[WARNING] Unknown Ptg 2a (42) at cell (24,1)

This exceeds the maximum allowable limit of 600. ]; nested exception is com.sybase.jdbc3.jdbc.SybSQLException: The current query would generate a key size of 799 for a work table. This exceeds the maximum allowable limit of 600.

caused by: com.sybase.jdbc3.jdbc.SybSQLException: The current query would generate a key size of 799 for a work table. This exceeds the maximum allowable limit of 600.

The label_findSingleDegreeSeparationFromLabel and label_findSingleDegreeSeparationFromLabelBySpace queries need to be changed for Sybase.

Module: confluence/ Error: weblogic.management.DeploymentException: com/atlassian/confluence/core/ConfluenceActionSupport - with nested exception:

fields.description:
I have seen many requests for hiding some of the user functionality (change password, for example) when Confluence uses LDAP authentication. I'm more interested in having that function (again, specifically change password) actually work with LDAP.  

The LDAP server we are using is strictly for our development environment...it's not tied to a corporate LDAP server.  Instead of developing or installing more tools to manage a simple task like allowing a user to have the ability to change their password, it would be preferable for us to have one of our existing tools support that functionality.  In our case, Confluence (or JIRA, really) seems like the ideal candidate.
fields.summary: Allow users to change their password when using LDAP user management

fields.description:
When using the User Search popup, as from the Edit Space Permissions page, searching for users by membership never returns any results.

This is because the xwork.xml is directing the doMembersOfGroupSearch action to userpicker.vm instead of userpicker-results.vm.  Easily remedied.
fields.summary: Search by membership in User Search never returns any results

fields.description:
At the moment, macros and other plugins that generate content are aware of their render mode but don't have the facilities to correctly render themselves for the destination format. The following things are often broken in the export of macros:

- links, especially to Confluence content
- images
- styles and complex markup

To fix this, macro plugins need access to a link/image URL generator for Confluence content.*

A better API that indicates which render modes are required would also help. The current method of relying on the author to check a field in the RenderContext means that the export render modes are often forgotten.

This issue incorporates specific instances of this problem.

* There is actually a linkRenderer in the renderContext already. But to use it means creating a Link object, which itself requires a GenericLinkParser, a Manager and the object to be linked to. Not the easiest interface to work with.
fields.summary: Macros and plugins should be able to render themselves properly for PDF and HTML export

fields.description: if i insert an image in page A which is attached to another page - page B, and then i change the name of page B to page C, then the embedded image is not appropriately modified to reflect this

fields.description:
When linking to an image whilst creating a news page, the error you get isn't very informative:

"The collection was unreferenced; nested exception is net.sf.hibernate.QueryException: The collection was unreferenced"

To reproduce, you should be able to create a news page, and put {noformat} !a.png! {noformat}, then click preview.
fields.summary: On preview of news, error is not informative when linking to non-existing image

fields.description:
When a user tries to restore a backup which can't be fitted into the address space they get a cryptic error it would be easy to catch it and explain it.

Of course a better solution is to fix http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-6673
fields.summary: Catch the zip-too-large-for-VM error and explain it

fields.description:
Yet another issue about PDF image export problems, but this time I know what the problem is: For embedded images on pages, capitalization doesn't matter. !foo.jpg! and !Foo.jpg! will both show the same image, regardless of the actual attachment filename.

However, if the capitalization in the wiki markup doesn't match the capitalization of the actual attachment, the image will be silently missing from the PDF export, even though it appears on the HTML page.

This should be consistent. Right now, it's maddening when images just vanish.
fields.summary: Images don't export to PDF if capitalization is wrong

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6912].
  {panel}

Currently, a logged-in user's display name is composed from the LDAP attributes givenName and sn. At a company where I am consulting, this doesn't work out right: 

 1. Sometimes a user's givenName isn't present, but his/her initials are. These users show up with just their surname.

 2. Typically a Dutch problem: surnames here often consist of a prefix (in my case 'van') and a 'main' surname (Zwetselaar). At this company, the prefix is stored in a separate attribute (snPrefix), and the main surname in the sn attribute. As a consequence, I show up as "Marco Zwetselaar" which isn't right either.

 3. Not a problem here, but I guess it would be in other countries, where surname is customarily shown before given name.

The solution would be if, instead of givenName + sn, the cn attribute would should be shown as the display name of the user. AFAIK, convention ally LDAPs use precisely that attribute to store the full name of the user.
fields.summary: Use the cn attribute to display the user's full name, not givenName + sn

fields.description: We are having issue with export page to word, some reason internal attached images are missing in the generated word document.
fields.summary: Word Export - missing images 2.2.8

fields.description:
Build: 2.2.8 Build:#525 

GIF images in the page don't showup right in the pdf export, while jpg work fine. Part of the image is missing.
fields.summary: GIF images not rendered properly while exporting to PDF. JPG image render fine

fields.description: There isn't any language packet for spanish.
fields.summary: Spanish Pack Language

fields.description:
Reindexing confluence.atlassian.com is taking an inordinate amount of time. Something must be wrong.

This has also been reported by some users in Confluence 2.2.8.
fields.summary: Rebuilding index gets progressively slower or fails

fields.description:
* The new license type footers are not rendering correctly in the dashboard or in the Confluence administration console - it is showing up with a grey bar instead of the nice yellow colour.
* In addition: the Developer license footer are rendering the following:

DEVELOPER LICENSE - This Confluence site is for non-production use only., [hitcounter.developer, Atlassian Software Systems]

We will need to kill the last bit.

* We will also need to update the existing open source/non-profit footer to match the new style. The updated wording is noted in the bottom of the following page:

http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/SALES/New+License+Types

Thanks!
fields.summary: New license types footers
Allow {children:page=/}  to work in any context with a space

fields.description: Browse space alphabetical view does not display titles which begin with numbers.
fields.summary: Browse space alphabetical view does not display titles which begin with numbers

fields.description: While a space snashot can be achieved manually with an XML export a customer has requested the ability to go beyond this and have a single button which would snapshot and version a space.
fields.summary: Native (built in) space snapshot (version) capability

fields.description: Confluence still respects the property set method of deactivation, but provides no information about it and doesn't allow users to be activated. A deactivated user should have a 'Reactivate' button in user managment.
fields.summary: Allow reactivation of deactivated users
Option to overwrite and version page if title already exists in same space

fields.description: It would be extremely useful in large Confluence installations if groups could be nested. For example, we've set up groups for individual development teams, but would like to add all of those teams to a development department group, and thence to a larger "IT" group. Currently we'd have to add hundreds of people into groups for their team, their function and their department.
fields.summary: Support groups-within-groups
Search terms should be highlighted in attachments

fields.description: Confluence, especially the dashboard is very slow to load on Firefox when using the official Google toolbar with its "subscribe" feature enabled. See the attached image. With "subscribe" disabled Firefox is just as fast as IE. This problem does not happen with all websites that have RSS feeds so it's not specific to the Google toolbar.
fields.summary: Unable to edit filters on Firefox when Subscribe feature of Google toolbar extension is enabled
